name: ResharperCli
description: Runs the Resharper Command-Line Tool and fails the build if code quality issues are found
author: Alan Wales

inputs.name: SolutionOrProjectPath
inputs.label: Path to .sln or .csproj file
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to find the solution or project file to inspect code against.

inputs.name: FailBuildLevelSelector
inputs.label: Fail build severity
inputs.helpMarkDown: Issues found at or above this severity level will fail the build

inputs.name: CommandLineInterfacePath
inputs.label: Path to command line tool
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use this setting to avoid downloading the CLT from NuGet and take it from a pre-set folder. The path can be inside the repository or a known location on the build agent (custom controller only). Inspectcode.exe must be available in this folder.

inputs.name: AdditionalArguments
inputs.label: Additional arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Customize the additional arguments provided to the CLT as specified by the CLT documentation.

inputs.name: ResharperNuGetVersion
inputs.label: Resharper NuGet version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Allows to install and use an older version of the NuGet package found at https://www.nuget.org/packages/JetBrains.ReSharper.CommandLineTools e.g. 2016.1.20160504.105828

inputs.name: ResultsOutputFilePath
inputs.label: Results output file path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Allows the default xml results file output location to be overridden e.g. $(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)\CodeQualityResults.xml. Results file is not deleted afterwards
